oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Knowledge sharing in organic food supply chains
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kottila, Marja-Riitta
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Markets and trade
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Although local, short supply chains are regarded as most suitable for organic products, most organic food is sold through general retailers. The extended supply chains create challenges: (1) how to sustain the connection between farmers and consumers and deliver the multifaceted value of organic food and (2) how to cooperate to meet both the needs of consumers and of each independent company involved in the supply chain. This publication gives among other things practical implications concerning organic food supply chains and marketing of organic products.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Kottila, Marja-Riitta (2009) Knowledge sharing in organic food supply chains. Paper at: 1st Nordic organic conference : towards increased sustainability in the food supply chain, Gothenburg, Sweden, 18-20 May 2009.
